Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/String/toReal

Function real toReal(str s) throws IllegalArgument(value v)
Description Converts string s to a real. Throws IllegalArgument when s cannot be converted.
Examples 
rascal>import String;
ok
rascal>toReal("2.5e-3");
real: 0.0025
rascal>toReal("123");
real: 123.
rascal>toReal("abc");
Uncaught Rascal Exception: prompt:///:1,7: IllegalArgument()
    somewhere in: $shell$
[Edit] | [New] | [Compile Course] | [Warnings]
